entry.summary: ...High Water Levels This Week... Around 1 inch of rain fell from Wednesday evening through early Wednesday afternoon in the southeast Brooks Range. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Huslia from Wednesday into Thursday. This high water will cause erosion of the Koyukuk River bank at Huslia. entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 15 at 4:54AM CDT until June 15 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms are forecast through this evening, mainly for areas along and south of Interstate 20. Thunderstorm activity will produce locally heavy rainfall, with the potential for repeated heavy rains over the same areas. Over the last few days, 2 to 5 inches of rain has fallen in some areas. An additional 1 to 2 inches is possible through this evening.
